title: UPDATE 1-India breaches 200,000 daily COVID-19 cases as hospital beds, oxygen fall short
description: India reported a record 200,000 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday and the financial hub of Mumbai entered a lockdown, as many hospitals treating coronavirus patients reported severe shortages of beds and oxygen supplies.  The surge was the seventh record daily increase in the last eight days and comes as India battles a massive second wave of infections that has its epicentre in the economically significant state of Maharashtra, home to Mumbai.  India reported 200,739 COVID-19 cases over the last 24 hours, according to health ministry data released Thursday.

title: Maharashtra: Thane records 5,566 new Covid-19 cases, 33 deaths in a day

title: Maharashtra Coronavirus Live Updates: Curfew-like curbs come into effect, 2 lakh cops hit streets to enforce restrictions
description: Maharashtra Coronavirus (Covid-19) and Lockdown News Live Updates: Prohibitory orders under Section 144 have been imposed till May 1, and no person will be allowed in a public place without a valid reason.

title: Maharashtra faces oxygen cylinders crisis amid surge in Covid-19 cases
description: Amidst the massive surge in Covid cases, Maharashtra is facing an acute shortage of oxygen cylinders. In Ahmednagar district, the daily demand ranges between 50 to 70 tonnes of oxygen, but the supply is around 15 tonnes.

description: On Tuesday, Thackeray had said that with the new curbs being implemented to break the chain of transmission, the state will spend at least Rs 5,200 crore on providing financial assistance to the poor working class.

title: Remdesivir no life-saving drug in COVID-19: Maharashtra task force
description: "It only arrests the replication of the virus and therefore reduces the hospital stay and convalescence of the patient by one-two days. This leads to a reduction inthe hospital stay by two days at the most. It is possible to save patients even without Remedesivir," the task force said in the advisory.

title: India's Maharashtra shuts most manufacturing, restricts e-commerce to fight COVID-19
description: India's richest state Maharashtra will impose stringent curbs on industry and e-commerce for 15 days to slow rising coronavirus infections, its chief minister said on Tuesday, a move that is set to cripple manufacturing and other businesses in the region.

title: Maharashtra Covid-19 crisis: Janta curfew in state from 8 pm tomorrow, only essential services to ply | HIGHLIGHTS
description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray addressed the state via social media at 8.30 pm on the prevailing Covid-19 situation in the state and announced a list of strict lockdown-like curbs that will be in force from 8 pm tomorrow. CM Uddhav Thackeray said the state will go into janta curfew from 8 pm tomorrow, adding that only essential services will be allowed.
